Dialogue: Ms. Toller.  I'm asking you now, under oath, did Samuel Lonbardo rape you?

Dialogue: Look.  I just don't want to get into any more trouble...

Dialogue: Miss Toller.

Dialogue: Your Honor... I must object...

Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Dialogue: I don't know.  I just wanted to hurt Mr. Lombardo.

Dialogue: Your Honor... Please...

Dialogue: Any more interruptions Mr. Hunter, and the Court will hold you in contempt.  What you are telling me, Ms. Toller, is that Kelly Van Ryan is responsible for conceiving this entire charade...

Dialogue: Kelly's pissed at Mr. Lombardo, too. She's in love with him.  I mean her whole fantasy is him since her old man died.  Then she found out that Mr. Lombardo was doing her mom.  I mean that was it...

Dialogue: You stupid little bitch...

Dialogue: I've found that adolescents make the best liars.  They're old enough to be good at it, but you want like hell to believe them, because they're still children.

Dialogue: Come on, let loose!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I was just thinking about where I'm gonna stay.  I lost the house.  It's like waking up from a goddamn nightmare.

Dialogue: You'll get over it. We've got a knockdown, airtight, motherfucker of a lawsuit against Sandra Van Ryan.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Just like that?

Dialogue: Just like that?  These people ruined your life, bro.

Dialogue: You don't think you're overdoing it?

Dialogue: Fuck off.

Speaker: baxter
Dialogue: See what I mean...

Dialogue: You like seeing your name in the papers?

Speaker: sandra
Dialogue: You've got to be kidding.

Dialogue: The man's life has been destroyed. There will always be doubters, no matter what happened in court.

Dialogue: I said that's what they'd ask for.

Dialogue: I hope you're happy.

Dialogue: Unless you're planning on leaving Blue Bay, there's gonna be other cases, other days... You might want to keep that in mind.

Dialogue: I... You know... I...

Dialogue: Take care of my lizards, Art.

Dialogue: Kelly...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Drop dead... You know where my mom is trying to get the money to pay you off? She's trying to break my trust.  How do you like that?  I can't touch it until she's dead and she won't give me a dime and now she's trying to break it to pay you...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Look, Kelly... I'm sorry... I know what you've been through... I should've seen something like this coning.

Dialogue: Why don't you start fucking her again. You can spend it together.

Dialogue: You see.  I couldn't stay, even if I wanted to.

Dialogue: I'll be seeing you.

Dialogue: So long, Tom.  Come by sometime.  We'll have lunch at the Beef Bowl.

Dialogue: I don't think you're gonna be eating at the Beef Bowl anymore, kid.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thanks Ken, you did okay.

Dialogue: Look, I know there's a part of you wishes none of this had happened.  But it did.  Now take the money and get out of here.  Find a happy place.

Dialogue: Damn maid.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ahhhh!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, what are you doing?

Dialogue: So you got my mom's money.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: About six and a half million dollars.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Your turn to pay.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: God, you scared the shit out of me.  You must be crazy coming here.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Of course I'm crazy.  Ask my mom.

Dialogue: How much is about six and a half million divided by three?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Jesus.  Two million one hundred thirty-three thousand three hundred thirty-three and change.

Dialogue: Hey, come on... We've got to have at least one victory party.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Kelly, for christ's sake...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Do it to ourselves?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We have to stick with the plan.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Stick?

Dialogue: You saw the news today?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Lombardo's settlement?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Hey, don't back away from it, you were right.  We did look stupid.  What you were wrong about, is who made us look that way.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Maybe Lombardo's attorney was saving the affair for the trial.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I thought of that.  Then I said, come on, you're Lombardo.  Your reputation is getting trashed.  You want to stop the bleeding.  You don't want to sit in jail for three months.  Unless...

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Unless what?

Dialogue: Unless you're setting up Sandra Van Ryan for the big payday.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Why?  You ask me, Lombardo had it pretty good already, nice job in a beautiful setting, popular, an active social life.  He's gonna put this all on the line for some dicey play like what you're describing...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: The job looks okay to us.  But look at it from his point of view.  The man's surrounded by wealth and privilege.  But for him... it's just a reminder of what should have been his.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: So what about the girls?  Suzie's poor, but why would Kelly have to steal from her own mother?  Surely her father...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Her father didn't leave her squat.  The kid's got money in trust from her grandfather, but she can't touch that till her mother dies and Sandra seems to have the idea that Kelly ought to learn the value of a buck.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: This one's got you working overtime, hasn't it?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I flat don't like the guy, Glory.  He's dirty.  And I'll tell you something else.  You want to know how old man Lombardo lost his money?  It was after the war.  Van Ryan set up a corporation to develop swamp land, got investors like Lombardo to put up money, then turned around and got the state to declare the area an ecological preserve, on the sly, of course, but everyone knew it was him.  The freeway went to the coast, right where Van Ryan wanted it.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Eliminate the competition.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You got it.  The rich got richer.  While the saps like Lombardo went belly-up in the swamp.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Where'd you come up with this stuff, anyway?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I net a guy in a bar.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Is there some reason why you're here?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Curiosity, I guess.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: About what?  How to improve your breast stroke?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Actually, I was curious about how you see things working out, for you, Sam and Suzie.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You all gonna go down to the Caribbean together?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: You're out of your mind.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I've been a cop for a while, Kelly.  It's hard enough for one person to keep a secret, let alone three.  And then there's the love angle.  I mean do you and Sam really want that little pill-head around, now that you have the money?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Police -- God -- get a life.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You're good.  But you don't think that little ditz Suzie's gonna hold together, do you?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: You don't know Duquette.  I'm the one he busted... He's a fucker, man... He'll fuck us both over...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Will you calm down.  Duquette's gonna come to you just like he did to me. You're gonna have to be ready for him.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Yeah, but he can't push you around like he can me.  You've got family and they've got clout.  With we it's different... with me...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Yeah, I've got family and they've got clout and now you have me.  Right?  And Sam.  Believe me, Suzie, this dickhead's not going to send you anywhere.  He's gonna try and rattle your cage, and that's it.  Stay strong and he can't do shit.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Man, I wanna smoke a joint.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You ought to watch it with that shit, Suzie.  You get busted again, you go back in a two-tine loser.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: You got something against cigarettes?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Yeah, they're bad for your health.  I'm tryin' to look out for you...

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: That's cop bullshit.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Well, you're half right.  Best thing you could do for yourself right now would be to talk to me.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: About what?

Dialogue: Every triangle I've ever seen never lasts.  Somebody's got to go.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Is this supposed to mean something to me?  What triangle?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You, Kelly, Sam.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: I don't have to listen to this.  And you can't shove me around.  I have friends now...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Is that what you think?  You have friends?  Is that what they told you?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: I don't mean who you're thinking.  I have other friends...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Suzie, Suzie... This is me, Ray, you're talking to.  We both know you don't have shit, never have had shit, never will have shit...

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Get away from me.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Don't you see what this means?  You really think Sam and Kelly are gonna give you a third of the money?  You, the pill-head with the rap sheet?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Shut up.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You know, I don't think I ever told you I was sorry about your little friend... What was his name?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Davy.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: That's right.  That was his name.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I can't believe you called Sam.  What's the matter with you?

Dialogue: I'm scared, that's what.  I'm scared there's no one to trust.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: You can trust me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Kelly.  Is Suzie there?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Shit.  I was afraid of that.  She left this garbled message on my machine.  Can you calm her down?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No!  Christ.  Listen, Kelly, I'm counting on you.  You calm her down. I mean do whatever you have to, whatever it takes...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Then do it.  I need you on this Kelly. Do it tonight.  We'll figure something out... Okay?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Yeah, right.  Can you at least talk to her, on the phone?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Put Kelly on too.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I'm here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Okay.  I want you to hear this too. We've got to be cool.  All of us. People think I'm rich, for Christ's sake.   I'm doing what rich guys do.  I'm spending my money.  It's more suspicious if I sit around doing nothing.  Now don't let this cop fuck with your minds.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: But I..

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Yeah, right.

Dialogue: You're gonna fuck me over, aren't you?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Oh, for Christ's sake.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: You are.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Are you retarded, or just brain dead from whiffin' fumes out there in the swamp...

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: That's what I am to you, isn't it? Swamp trash.  It's what I am to everybody, just like my mom...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Stupid bitch.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Why do you make me hurt you?  It's like you want it or something.

Dialogue: Are you crazy, Ray?

Dialogue: You heard Kelly say "Sam."  That was Lombardo on the phone.  And you saw the girls...

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Ray.  The conversation on this tape is totally unintelligible.  What we have here, is you on the Van Ryan property, without a proper warrant, shooting a porn flick...

Dialogue: I don't believe I'm hearing this.  A month ago you were pulling these two apart at the courthouse.  They were acting.  They were all acting, from the beginning.  And we bought it, hook, line and sinker... And now they're home free with six million of Sandra Van Ryan's money.

Dialogue: Which she might have saved, if she hadn't set out to destroy the man's life.

Dialogue: Cone on.  She bought the same story we did...

Dialogue: Listen, both of you.  You're not on a case.  There is no fucking case.  Am I getting through on this?

Dialogue: Oh, Ray... no...

Dialogue: You think this is just about money, about us looking foolish?  Question him. You're gonna find a stone cold manipulative psychopath.  And those girls are going to wind up dead...

Dialogue: Mr. Lombardo, please.  I'm sorry about this.

Dialogue: Give this idiot something to do.  Let him look into the Kennedy assassination.

Dialogue: Guess I kind of lost it there.

Dialogue: You could say that.

Dialogue: Were you ever in a situation where you could see a thing coming and you didn't do what you could to stop it?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: We all have...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I mean something bad, Gloria, something bad you saw coning, and you didn't do anything, and then it happened.  I did that once.  I don't want to do it again.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You look pretty.

Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hey, I've got it, I may as well spend it, right?  I've always wanted to live where I could dive for my dinner.

Dialogue: And where might that be?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I was thinking, Antigua, maybe.

Dialogue: I love Antigua.  Maybe I'll come visit you.

Dialogue: I'd like that.

Dialogue: Jesus.  What are you drinking?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: What brain?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: I thought we were goin' to a movie.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I think we just need to get wasted.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: I wanna live at the beach someday.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Shit.

Dialogue: Kelly?

Dialogue: Suzie, it's okay.  It's me.

Dialogue: Are you mad at me?

Dialogue: No, no.  Look, I probably should have told you a little more, about the part I intended to play.  We'll go through it all again tonight.

Dialogue: I'm sorry, Kelly.  I'm sorry it had to happen like this.  She was losing it...

Dialogue: There was no way.  That cop would've gotten her to tell him... everything. She was weak and dumb...

Dialogue: Are you okay?

Dialogue: My mom would kill me if she knew I took the Rover.

Dialogue: Been four-wheelin'?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Get off my property.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I'm not on your property!

Dialogue: You say she didn't come back last night.

Dialogue: She's been sayin' she was going to go to L.A.  But I don't know.  I mean all her clothes are still here.  An' she's missin' her graduation.  She should graduate.  She's a smart girl...

Dialogue: May have been she just partied too much... But we'll look into it.  We find something, you'll be the first to know.

Dialogue: It's starting, Gloria.  This is how it begins...

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Ray.  We don't know anything yet.  She could be anywhere...

Dialogue: I'm gonna take you back to the office. Will you put out a call on Suzie's car for me?

Dialogue: You have someplace to be?

Dialogue: Just check out the car.

Dialogue: Smile.

Dialogue: You didn't have to fly back -- from -- wherever, for me...

Dialogue: I'm here to congratulate my friends and their children.  I'm leaving again tonight.

Dialogue: Don't bother.  I'm taking a trip.

Dialogue: Where, the mall?

Dialogue: A friend of mine bought a boat.

Dialogue: It's those rocks, up there.

Dialogue: You and Suzie used to come out here together?

Dialogue: Yeah, sometimes.  Lots of the kids hang out here.  You really think something bad happened to Suzie?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Lombardo ever come out here?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: No.  But I mean... just the idea that Mr. Lombardo would...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Way I hear it, he was pretty tight with the kids, one of the guys...

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Yeah, but...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I'm going to be staying here, Jimmy. You can catch a bus up there at the lot, okay?

Dialogue: People aren't always what they appear to be, kid.  Remember it.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Lonbardo and Kelly killed her here.

Dialogue: Two kids could've gotten into a fight, lost a couple of teeth.

Dialogue: Those are Suzie Toller's teeth.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Where's the body?

Dialogue: The swamp, most likely... Lombardo's a swamp rat, knows the body will never be found there.  But he's made a mistake.

Dialogue: Her grandmother said she'd been threatening to run away.  And I found the car at the Miami bus terminal.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You don't think Sam could've put it there?

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Dust it for prints.  My guess is, if anybody murdered Suzie it was probably that little sociopath Kelly Van Ryan.

Dialogue: How soon can we get something?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: We can get blood type right away. Dental records will take longer.  You want DNA, that can take weeks.

Dialogue: We don't know that, Ray...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Kelly's next, Gloria.

Dialogue: You get an ID, you call me.

Dialogue: Will you do me one favor?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Ray, you heard him...

Dialogue: What if I'm right, Gloria?  What if I'm right and Hunter's wrong?  What do you do if you see a bad thing coming?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: And if the teeth aren't Suzie's?  You'll give this up?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: If I'm wrong about those teeth -- it's a promise.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: The teeth doin' any talkin'?

Dialogue: What about the blood?

Dialogue: Second you get something on those teeth, I want it

Dialogue: Hello.

Dialogue: I'm really serious.  That cop, he keeps watching me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Duquette.  Forget him...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I can't help it.  He gives me the creeps... I mean why was Suzie so scared of him?  She's not that way.  I think he did something...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah, he got her busted for possession...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I don't know... I think it was something else... Suzie says the bust was bullshit...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: And you believe her?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I want to see you...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Kelly... Relax.  Take one of your mom's valium or something.  In another week you get on the plane.  It's over.  We're rich.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: But what if they find out... God, they'd put you in the gas chamber...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: So if they're tapping your phone, we're dead.  Stay in the guest house.  Skip the graduation parties.  You'll never see Duquette.  Okay?  I love you.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Okay.  I love you too.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Isn't that against the law, peeking into windows?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Suzie Toller is missing.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How long?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: She didn't cone home last night.  We found her car at the bus terminal, but nothing to suggest she bought a ticket.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Maybe she used another name.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Ray thinks she was murdered.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't know what to say...

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: You could tell me where you were last night.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Goddannit... I don't have to...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Come here.  I want you to see something.

Dialogue: Looks like goodbye.

Dialogue: Kelly's file.  Read it.  You're going to find an angry, sexually confused girl who's made threats on her mother's life and a female lover she'd never identify.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Suzie?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You're telling me Ray thinks Suzie was killed.  I don't have to ask you who he thinks did it, do I?  All I'm saying is, read that, you'll have a new perspective on things.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell us about this before the trial?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Then -- I still had ethical standards to protect.  They meant a lot to me.  Now, I don't care.  And no amount of money can buy that back.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Ray.  What's happening?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: I'm tired, Ray.  I'm going home.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Where's Lombardo?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: He's leaving the country.  And I don't give a shit.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: The blood type on the rocks matches Suzie's.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: It's Homicide's job now, Ray, let 'em do it.  I'll tell you something else, there's more to this story than you know, Ray... If Suzie is dead, I think Hunter may be on the right track...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Detective Duquette, Ms. Van Ryan.  Let me in.  Now.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: sandra
Dialogue: Where she lives.  In the guest house. Now will you tell me what this is about?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I'm placing your daughter under arrest.

Speaker: sandra
Dialogue: You can't...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Suzie Toller is dead.  You don't want Kelly to be next, then take my advice. Stay out of my way.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I fucked up.  I lost control of the situation, the one thing they train you for... God, what did I do?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I told Kelly Van Ryan she was under arrest for conspiracy and murder.  I did her rights.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Kelly went crazy, started screaming.  I grabbed her, put her on the floor.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Bit, scratched.  But I had her pinned. She calmed down.  I was going to cuff her... She said she thought she was going to be sick.  She asked to use the bathroom.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I told her I was coming with her.  She nodded, like she understood.  We stood up together.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: She looked shaky, but lucid.  I thought, I would just go with her, stand at the door...  I didn't go down, but she slowed me up, just enough.  Before I could get to her, she'd turned on me with this small caliber handgun.  I yelled at her to put it down.  She got off a shot.  I took it in the shoulder.  I... I had no choice. I returned fire.  Two rounds, I think. In the chest.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I went there to protect her...

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: Detective Duquette; our investigation concludes that this was a good shooting. But that's irrelevant.  You were not assigned to this case -- whatever you imagined this case to be.  And now two young women are dead.  You are terminated with forfeiture of pension and benefits.

Dialogue: Suzie Toller's teeth and blood were found near the area known as Stoner Rocks.  Suzie's blood was found in the Van Ryan Range Rover.  This, in conjunction with evidence obtained by Detectives Duquette and Perez has led this office to the conclusion that Susan Marie Toller was murdered by Kelly Lanier Van Ryan...

Dialogue: Buy you a drink?

Dialogue: Jesus.  I wasn't expecting you 'til tomorrow.

Dialogue: Nice girlfriend you had there.

Dialogue: Yeah, well, you fixed that.  What the hell happened, anyway?

Dialogue: The bitch shot me, is what happened.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Did you become squeamish about these things before or after you bludgeoned little Suzie Toller to death with a wine bottle?  We should be celebrating.  This thing worked out just like you said, only better.

Dialogue: Kelly was supposed to be framed, not killed.  What I'm telling you is, I don't like surprises.

Dialogue: Every cloud has a silver lining, partner.  Here's to no loose ends.

Dialogue: Here's to no more surprises.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Gator can't see what's in front of it for shit.  They see out the sides.  That one don't even know Walter's arm's in his mouth.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: What if something distracts it and it snaps anyway?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Then I guess Walter can kiss that arm of his goodbye.  He don't use it for no good deeds anyway.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: About Suzie?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Actually, I was wondering if I might ask you about Ray Duquette.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: He used to come around here.  He had a thing going with one of the girls over at the Glades.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: She still work there?

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: No.  Not after that night.  It was right after that, Ray got Suzie busted and sent her away.  That's what there is to say about Ray Duquette.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Was there ever any kind of investigation...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Duquette always claimed the kid was dusted, came after him with a knife. But it was Jack's Fish Camp... This could be the moon for all most people care.  Wasn't supposed to be like that though. This place was supposed to be something once.  There were going to be roads and houses.  There was going to be a town. They were going to call it Salt Creek.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ray... you see that winch by your head? Take a couple of turns on it for me, she's luffing.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You mean this thing?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yes, we call it a winch.  And these are shrouds, and these are stays.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: I thought this was supposed to be a vacation.  Why didn't you buy a nice big power boat?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Come on, man.  I'll make a sailor out of you yet.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Yeah, or get me drowned.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Jesus, man... You okay?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: That how you planned it?  You take cut Suzie, get me to hang it on Kelly, then dump me in the ocean...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Come off it, man... It was an accident.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You... You're...

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Rumors of my demise have been greatly exaggerated.  Nice move.  Good thing I was here to save your incompetent ass.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: You... I should've killed you myself. should never have left it up to him...

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Shoulda, coulda, woulda...  Get him in the water.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Sam, for Christ's sake...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I can't.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Sam, for godsake.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Hey, Ray.  Guess whose name is on the numbered bank account besides yours and Sam's?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Feeling better?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That was about as grim as it gets.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: The guy was history when he killed Kelly.  You knew that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: But then you knew what he was like all along... Maybe his killing Kelly was a thing you had counted on...

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: But then it is better this way, don't you think?  No loose ends.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That was the same thing Ray said.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Poor Ray.  Come on Sam, we did it.  We put the screws to the Van Ryans.  We won.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Okay.  Grab that winch there.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Fuck the winch.  I wanna drive.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Okay.  Come here and take the helm. I'll get the winch.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You asked if Suzie knew about the Salt Creek land deal?  Girl read every book she could find on it, the Van Ryans too.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Wasn't enough Van Ryan had to destroy the people who invested here.  He got to be old, he and his rich cronies would come down here, hunt and whore, act like assholes.  One trip he showed up with this young girl he'd picked up somewhere, gotten her pregnant then dumped her in the swamp.  That came with her.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: And the child...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: She had it, before she drank herself to death.  Wasn't exactly a love child...

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Suzie.  Then you're not her grandmother...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: Raised her like she was, but no, Walter's my only child.  He was a good boy, till the army took him.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: So Suzie and Sandra Van Ryan were half- sisters.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: And the other girl, Kelly.  Suzie's niece.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Thank you for talking to me, Ruby.  I am sorry about Suzie, she...

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: I'm fine.  Nice TV.

Speaker: ruby
Dialogue: There's an old saying from the Everglades -- virtue may be missed but sin can't hide.  Folks pay in the end.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You know the place I'm talking about -- the big rocks?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: You've got the pressure too tight. You'll crush the fucking evidence.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We gotta stop.  I'm gonna come.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: That never seemed to worry you at the Glades.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's not your line.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: Say you love me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I love you.  Now give me the line.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: No little girl can ever make me come.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Seems to like some of the same places you do.  Funny you never met.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah, real funny.  You're wrong about this, I could get busted on the spot.

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Trust me, the guy's dirty.  He'll like it.  Especially the part about offing me.  Now get out of here.  Go make yourself a new friend.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Buy you a drink?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: You like bein' a caddy for rich kids' problems?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We?

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Well, I'd need the famous Lombardo charm, not that you'd have to do anything you haven't done already.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How...

Speaker: suzie
Dialogue: Walter.  He's been aimin' that Brownie through knotholes for years.  I saw these, I knew he'd finally struck gold.  I can't decide which came out better, that little straw Kelly's got up her nose, or that vibrator you've got up her ass.  What do you think, Mr. Lombardo?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I think there's some things you do, you don't want to see yourself doing them.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I'm running away.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You think that's wise?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I have toys.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Well, Z guess one taste wouldn't hurt.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: Selling your boat?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: This was Suzie's boat.  Guess she won't be needin' it.

Speaker: gloria
Dialogue: I wouldn't have guessed Suzie was a sailor.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Old lady had her tested once.  They said her IQ was way up there, round two hundred or some such shit.  That girl could do just about anything, she put her mind to it.
